content: Mullen meets families of five slain servicemembers at Dover arrival DOVER AIR FORCE BASE, Del. — Adm. Mike Mullen, chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff and the senior member of the U.S. military, traveled from Washington unannounced Wednesday night to join family members gathered to witness the return of the five U.S. troops slain in Monday’s rampage at a mental health clinic in Iraq. In a chill wind, the admiral stood at attention on the Dover Air Force Base tarmac with the transfer team, and was the first person to salute as the remains of each servicemember’s body arrived back on American soil. Full article at >>>http://www.stripes.com/article.asp?section=104&article=62677

title: Mullen meets families of five slain servicemembers at Dover arrival

content: That was admirable of him...such a sad loss.
